markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tiger's Claw](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1186)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Primal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=134" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 166</row>

**Price** 1,400 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Dueling Pistol](/Weapons.aspx?ID=201)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This +2 _[striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [fearsome](/Equipment.aspx?ID=731) [dueling pistol](/Weapons.aspx?ID=201)_ is made from fine tigerwood, with the head of a tiger as the muzzle. Beneath the tiger head is a claw shaped [bayonet](/Weapons.aspx?ID=186). One of a set of four guns crafted as a gift to a Zenj family for delivery of rare healing and disease-abating herbs during an outbreak of a deadly disease in the Grand Duchy of Alkenstar, these firearms are now passed down to those who have done brave acts in service to the Zenj people. The flintlock sparks thrown by this weapon take the shape of pouncing tigers and the firearm's report sounds like a tiger's growl. Clever wielders use the firearm's report to panic their prey into mistakes and then pounce for the kill.

 This firearm's bullets deal slashing damage instead of piercing and add an additional 1d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) on a critical hit. This persistent bleed damage causes tiger-claw-shaped wounds to appear on the target.

<document level="2" id="action-986" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Tiger's Claw

text: <title level="1" right="Item 11" pfs="Standard" > Tiger's Claw Source Guns & Gears pg. 166 Price 1,400 gp Usage held in 1 hand Bulk 1 Base Weapon Dueling Pistol --- This +2 striking fearsome dueling pistol is made from fine tigerwood, with the head of a tiger as the muzzle. Beneath the tiger head is a claw shaped bayonet. One of a set of four guns crafted as a gift to a Zenj family for delivery of rare healing and disease-abating herbs during an outbreak of a deadly disease in the Grand Duchy of Alkenstar, these firearms are now passed down to those who have done brave acts in service to the Zenj people. The flintlock sparks thrown by this weapon take the shape of pouncing tigers and the firearm's report sounds like a tiger's growl. Clever wielders use the firearm's report to panic their prey into mistakes and then pounce for the kill. This firearm's bullets deal slashing damage instead of piercing and add an additional 1d6 persistent bleed damage on a critical hit. This persistent bleed damage causes tiger-claw-shaped wounds to appear on the target.
